alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Garfield; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 5:55PM MST until February 22 at 6:45PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST FOR SOUTHWESTERN EAGLE...NORTHWESTERN PITKIN AND SOUTHEASTERN GARFIELD COUNTIES... At 555 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Snowmass to 7 miles southwest of Basalt, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Colorado 82 between mile markers 16 and 40. Colorado 133 between mile markers 59 and 65. Locations impacted include... Aspen, Basalt, Snowmass, Snowmass Village, El Jebel, Woody Creek and Emma. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
